desc1.pins3: /OC1A - Output compare matchA output(inverted): The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.
desc1.pins4: SDA - 2-wire Serial Bus Data: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Data I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal, and the pin is driven by an open collector driver with slew rate limitation.
desc1.pins5: DI - Data Input - Universal serial interface
desc1.pins6: MOSI - Data input pin for memory downloading or SPI.

desc2.pins3: OC1A - Output compare matchA output: The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output com-pareA. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1A pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.
desc2.pins4: DO - Data Output - Universal serial interface
desc2.pins5: MISO - Data output pin for memory uploading or SPI.

desc3.pins3: /OC1B - Output compare matchB output (inverted). The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.
desc3.pins4: SCL - 2-wire Serial Interface Clock: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Clock I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal.
desc3.pins5: USCK - 3-wire mode Universal serial interface clock
desc3.pins6: SCK - Clock input pin for memory up/downloading or SPI.

desc4.pins3: OC1B - Output compare matchB output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareB. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1B pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function.

desc7.pins3: XTAL1 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (input)
desc7.pins5: /OC1D - Output compare matchD output (inverted). The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareD. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1D pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function

desc8.pins3: XTAL2 - Pin for connecting external clock source (crystal, resonator..) for MCU (output)
desc8.pins5: OC1D - Output compare matchD output. The pin can serve as an external output for the Timer/Counter1 output compareD. The pin has to be configured as an output to serve this function. See the timer description on how to enable this function. The OC1D pin is also the output pin for the PWM mode timer function

desc9.pins3: T0 - Timer/Counter0 clock source. See the Timer description for further details.
desc9.pins4: INT0 - External Interrupt source 0 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc10.pins3: /RESET - Reset pin for MCU, active at low.

desc11.pins3: AIN1 - AIN1, Analog Comparator Negative Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the negative input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

desc12.pins3: AIN0 - AIN0, Analog Comparator Positive Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the positive input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

desc13.pins3: AIN2 - AIN2, Analog Comparator Negative/Positive Input. When configured as an input and with the internal MOS pull-up resistor switched off, this pin also serves as the negative input of the on-chip Analog Comparator.

desc14.pins3: ICP0 - Timer/Counter0 Input Capture pin. See the Timer/Counter0 description for further details.

desc15.pins1: AVCC - Power supply for AD converter.

desc17.pins3: AREF - Reference voltage for AD converter.

desc18.pins3: SCL - 2-wire Serial Interface Clock: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Clock I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal.
desc18.pins4: USCK - 3-wire mode Universal serial interface clock
desc18.pins5: INT1 - External Interrupt source 1 to the MCU. See the interrupt description for further details and how to enable the source.

desc19.pins3: DO - Data Output - Universal serial interface

desc20.pins3: SDA - 2-wire Serial Bus Data: When the TWEN bit in TWCR is set (one) to enable the 2-wire Serial Interface, pin is disconnected from the port and becomes the Serial Data I/O pin for the 2-wire Serial Interface. In this mode, there is a spike filter on the pin to capture spikes shorter than 50 ns on the input signal, and the pin is driven by an open collector driver with slew rate limitation.
desc20.pins4: DI - Data Input - Universal serial interface
